result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reicland Alda Morris

Defendant Reicland Alda Morris in court.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad in court for Reicland Alda Morris.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Case in court for motion hearing. Arguments heard from the State. No objections from defense. Court placed on the record, findings of fact and legal analysis. For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTED the state's motion for joinder.

Defendant Reicland Alda Morris appeared by video.  Attorney Aneeq Ahmad appeared by video for Reicland Alda Morris.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. State counsel requests an adjournment, due to witness availability. No objections from defense. Court grants request and vacates  09/12/2022 jury trial date. Further, the court schedules new final pre-trial and jury trial dates to Br 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5.18.22, filed.

Defendant Reicland Alda Morris in court.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Aneeq Ahmad, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Reicland Alda Morris in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Reicland Alda Morris in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reicland Alda Morris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
